result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; defn present w/Atty Lencioni; DDA Moeser present, issue of co-defn's non-appearance addressed (bench warrant issued in that case);upon motion of DDA Moeser, Ct ruled severing the cases, proceeded to jury trial on this case; jurors brought to the courtroom & sworn; Ct gives preliminary instructions; Opening Statement by DDA Moeser; Opening Statement by Atty Lencioni; State's witnesses called, sworn & testified; direct exam by DDA Moeser, exhibits 1 thru 4 marked, exhibits 1, 2 & 3 offered & received; cross exam by Atty Lencioni; witnesses excused; State rest subject to rebuttal; defense will not be presenting any evidence; jurors excused for lunch, Ct & counsel review final instructions & verdict forms; Ct recessed; Ct resumed; Ct read final instructions to the jurors; closing argument by DDA Moeser; closing argument by Atty Lencioni; rebuttal argument by DDA Moeser; Ct finishes reading final instructions; alternate juror selected; bailiff sworn; jurors sent to the jury deliberation room; Ct recessed; Ct resumed; jurors brought to the courtroom; verdict forms given to the Judge; Judge reads the verdict forms; Judge polled the jury; jurors excused; DDA Moeser moved for judgment on the verdict; Ct rendered judgment of guilt on both verdicts; no request to revoke bail; no request for PSI; Atty Lencioni requests that we set this case after the new one catches up; Ct adjourned.
exhibits #1 thru 4
